text:
I think we should support this version. The problem is located in some display in the dataset fetcher:

`displayed_url = urllib.parse.splitquery(url)[0] if verbose == 1 else url`

A solution would be to replace `splitquery` by `url.split('?')[0]`.
title: Nilearn is not compatible with six 1.5.2 (361 day old version)
Nilearn is not compatible with six 1.5.2 (361 day old version)
